intro: Benthamia nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's benthamia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, with a fuzzy texture. Benthamia nuttallii produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
